evidence.location: IV. FACTUAL AND LEGAL BACKGROUND, Page 15
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Administration is leveraging federal funding to advance the President’s ideological vision. Upon taking office in January 2025, President Trump issued a series of executive orders that aim to effect sweeping social changes, including by directing agency heads to impose conditions on federal funding. Bolstering that effort, the Administration has announced it will weaponize the False Claims Act to threaten massive liability to federal funding recipients who do not comply with the Administration’s conditions.

extracted.value: The Administration is leveraging federal funding to advance the President’s ideological vision. Upon taking office in January 2025, President Trump issued a series of executive orders that aim to effect sweeping social changes, including by directing agency heads to impose conditions on federal funding. Bolstering that effort, the Administration has announced it will weaponize the False Claims Act to threaten massive liability to federal funding recipients who do not comply with the Administration’s conditions.

evidence.location: IV. FACTUAL AND LEGAL BACKGROUND, Page 15
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In his first days in office, President Trump issued multiple executive orders attacking “diversity, equity, and inclusion” (DEI) and “diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility” (DEIA) initiatives. See, e.g., Exec. Order No. 14151, 90 Fed. Reg. 8339 (Jan. 20, 2025); Exec. Order No. 14173, 90 Fed. Reg. 8663 (Jan. 21, 2025) (Anti-DEI Order).

extracted.value: In his first days in office, President Trump issued multiple executive orders attacking “diversity, equity, and inclusion” (DEI) and “diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility” (DEIA) initiatives, including Exec. Order No. 14151 and Exec. Order No. 14173.

evidence.location: IV. FACTUAL AND LEGAL BACKGROUND, Page 15
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Together, these orders reflect a far-ranging mission to entirely eradicate diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility programs and values.

extracted.value: The orders reflect a far-ranging mission to entirely eradicate DEI and DEIA programs and values.

evidence.location: IV. FACTUAL AND LEGAL BACKGROUND, Page 15
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: For instance, one order directs agencies to terminate all DEI and DEI offices, all “equity” programs, and all “equity-related” grants or contracts. Ending Radical and Wasteful Government DEI Programs and Preferencing, Exec. Order No. 14151, § 2(b).

extracted.value: One order directs agencies to terminate all DEI and DEI offices, all “equity” programs, and all “equity-related” grants or contracts.

evidence.location: IV. FACTUAL AND LEGAL BACKGROUND, Page 15
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Another order on “Ending Illegal Discrimination and Restoring Merit-Based Opportunity” (Anti-DEI Order), takes steps to end what it deems “illegal” DEI and DEIA in the federal government and the private sector.

extracted.value: Another order on “Ending Illegal Discrimination and Restoring Merit-Based Opportunity” takes steps to end what it deems “illegal” DEI and DEIA in the federal government and the private sector.

evidence.location: IV. FACTUAL AND LEGAL BACKGROUND, Page 16
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: To advance that goal, the Anti-DEI Order revokes multiple diversity-related executive actions issued over the last half century; purports to “streamline[]” the federal contracting process by, among other things, ordering a contracting compliance office to “immediately cease … [p]romoting diversity”; and directs the Office of Management and Budget to “[e]xcise references to DEI and DEI principles, under whatever name they may appear,” from federal funding procedures and to “[t]erminate all ‘diversity,’ ‘equity,’” and similar programs and activities.

extracted.value: The Anti-DEI Order revokes multiple diversity-related executive actions issued over the last half century; orders a contracting compliance office to immediately cease promoting diversity; and directs the Office of Management and Budget to excise references to DEI and DEI principles from federal funding procedures and to terminate all ‘diversity,’ ‘equity,’ and similar programs and activities.
